channel.title: Ushome | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - all the latest US news, showbiz, science, sport and health stories from the Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Senior Rand Paul campaign official says Trump 'is going to dive eventually' as reporters start demanding 'specific plans' from billionaire White House wannabe
item.description: 'Any candidate you give hours and hours and hours of coverage, which is what has happened with Trump ... they're going to do just as well,' said Rep. Raul Labrador, Paul's western US chairman.
item.media:description: UNITED STATES - JULY 26: Sen. Rand Paul, R-Ky., reacts to a question about Sen. Ted Cruz as he arrives for the rare Sunday session in the Senate on July 26, 2015. (Photo By Bill Clark/CQ Roll Call)

item.title: The Beatles hamming it up by the pool at British actor Reginald Owen's Bel Air mansion
item.description: Never before seen photos of legendary British rock group The Beatles taken by their manager Bob Bonis while on vacation in August 1964 were released on Thursday.

item.title: The Daily Show fans line up at dawn to Jon Stewart's farewell show
item.description: Fans of The Daily Show began lining up at dawn for a chance to get tickets to see the final taping of the Comedy Central show as Jon Stewart prepares to say farewell after 16 seasons.

item.title: Tombstone with name of 8-year-old who died in 1998 found in New Jersey bus depot
item.description: A maintenance worker found the memorial stone at a location used by NJ Transit in the town of Nutley, not far from Jersey City.

item.title: GOP presidential debate arena is EMPTY as second-tier candidates face off
item.description: Candidates including Bobby Jindal, Rick Perry and Carly Fiorina were met by some 20,000 empty seats in the first debate of the night at the Quicken Loans arena in Cleveland, Ohio.
item.media:description: Republican presidential candidates from left, Jim Gilmore, Lindsey Graham, Bobby Jindal, Rick Perry, Rick Santorum, Carly Fiorina, and George Pataki participate in a pre-debate forum at the Quicken Loans Arena, Thursday, Aug. 6, 2015, in Cleveland. Seven of the candidates have not qualified for the primetime debate. (AP Photo/John Minchillo)

item.title: Native Americans lose fight to wear long hair in prisons for their religious beliefs
item.description: The 11th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals court this week upheld an Alabama prison policy requiring male inmates to keep their hair cut short.

item.title: 'Happy Hour' debate sees bottom-tier Republicans take shots at Donald Trump
item.description: Rick Perry and Carly Fiorina hammer The Donald, who won't take the stage until four hours later. 'How can you run for the Republican nomination and be for single-payer health care?' Perry asked.

item.title: Grover Connor arrested in the killing of Louisiana police officer Thomas LaValley
item.description: Suspect Grover Deandre Cannon was wanted not only in the fatal shooting of Officer Thomas LaValley on Wednesday but also in connection with another shooting in July, Louisiana State Police said.
item.media:description:
Police officer in Shreveport, La., shot and killed responding to call; shooter at largeLouisiana police pledged they will not rest until the ?coward? who gunned down a hero police officer in Shreveport is behind bars for his heinous crime.
Police Officer Thomas LaValley, 29, was shot multiple times Wednesday while responding to a call of a suspicious person in the Queensborough neighborhood about 9:15 p.m., police said.
Authorities say 27-year-old Grover Cannon is wanted in connection with the slaying.
?We will scour the earth and wherever he goes we will find him,? Shreveport Police Chief Willie Shaw told reporters Thursday during a solemn news conference.
?There is nowhere that he can go. There is nothing that he can do to stop us from bringing him to justice. We will not rest,? Shaw added. ?He is nothing to me but a coward.?

item.title: Newlyweds Jennifer Aniston and Justin Theroux pictured boarding a private jet bound for honeymoon after secret A-list ceremony at Bel Air mansion
item.description: Jennifer Aniston and Justin Theroux were honeymoon bound on Thursday morning as they boarded a private jet after marrying in a secret ceremony at their Bel Air mansion last night.

item.title: Ben Carson praises Donald Trump before first primary debate in Cleveland, Ohio
item.description: Trump 'doesn't seem to care very much about what people think' about his brash approach, 'and that's kind of a refreshing thing,' he told reporters. But 'brain surgery is much more difficult' than debating.
item.media:description: Republican presidential candidate, Ben Carson speaks to reporters after participating in a rapid fire Q&A with Facebook at their lounge at Quicken Loans Arena in Cleveland, Thursday, Aug. 6, 2015, before tonight's first Republican presidential debate. (AP Photo/Andrew Harnik)

item.title: East Paulding Middle School in Texas ridiculed on social media after grammatical error
item.description: East Paulding Middle School in Dallas, Texas, became the butt of many a joke this week after staff posted a sign outside its main building which read: 'Welcome back students. We are glad you are hear.'

item.title: Jenson Button and wife Jessica gassed as burglars steal £300k worth of belongings
item.description: Jenson Button was gassed by burglars before having £300,000 worth of belongings stolen from his house in France. The burglars took his wife Jessica's £250,000 engagement ring.

item.title: Andy Murray and Kim Sears announce they are expecting their first baby
item.description: British tennis star Andy Murray and new wife Kim Sears are expecting a baby, it has been reported. The couple, who married in April, are said to be overjoyed by the news.

item.title: Shawn Robinson, 41, found dead in his New Orleans hotel room
item.description: Hollywood stuntman Shawn Robinson, 41, who has worked on Captain America and Transformers, was found dead after he failed to report to work July 28.

item.title: Photographer Jesse Holland captures her dog and daughter posing in identical images
item.description: Jesse Holland, from Victoria, British Columbia, began photographing her daughter Ella and their five-year-old French bulldog/Boston terrier mix Charlie just over a year ago.

item.title: Boston Gardner Museum heist video could solve $500m art heist
item.description: Twenty-five years after the famed art heist at Boston's Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum, the FBI have released video showing an unauthorized visitor entering the museum the night before the robbery.
item.media:description: In this March 18, 1990 still image from surveillance video released by the U.S. Attorney's Office,Thursday, Aug. 6, 2015, an unauthorized visitor walks inside the rear entrance of the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum in Boston. Robbers stole more than a dozen works of art at the museum about 24 hours later. Twenty five years later, the artwork remains missing and no one has ever been charged in the heist. (Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum/U.S. Attorney's Office via AP)

item.title: Eating plenty of fruit and veg DOES help us live longer
item.description: Scientists from the Scripps Research Institute in San Diego found that antioxidants can keep a vital organ called the thymus healthy by stopping age-related damage in its tracks.

item.title: Harrison Ford's plane crash was caused by a faulty carburetor
item.description: The carburetor inside Harrison Ford's vintage Second World War broke and rotated, a report says, flooding the engine with fuel meaning it cut out during takeoff in California back in March.

item.title: Bristol Palin shows off her growing baby bump for the first time since announcing second pregnancy
item.description: The 24-year-old announced that she was pregnant with her second child shortly after calling off her wedding to Marine veteran Dakota Meyer. Her first child, Tripp, was born when she was 18.

item.title: Tesla reveals video of its 'solid metal snake' charger connecting to Model S
item.description: A video posted on Tesla's Twitter account today shows the probing metal snake slithering its way to the car before beginning the charging process. It is not yet known when it will be available.

item.title: Bella Hadid turns tour guide in spoof video about Los Angeles
item.description: Bella Hadid, 18, stars in a funny new video for i-D that sees her frolicking on a beach in a white swimsuit with her friends, taking selfies, stocking up on kale and otherwise mocking LA stereotypes.

item.title: One Direction shoot new video Drag Me Down at NASA
item.description: The boys convinced bosses at the iconic headquarters to allow them to use their airfields, training equipment and facilities to shoot the promo.

item.title: Baby sloth is born at Chicago's Lincoln Park Zoo
item.description: The Hoffman's two-toed sloth was born July 25 to 21-year-old mother Hersey and 32-year-old father Carlos, Lincoln Park Zoo said Thursday.

item.title: New Jersey police chief 'sent fellow officer's wife' begging for sex
item.description: Kenneth Hartman, head of Far Hills Police Department in New Jersey, allegedly sent 22 graphic messages to Officer Jason Shanaphy's wife in just 45 minutes on August 20, 2014.

item.title: MTV's Chanel West Coast shows off bruises on her forearms from nightclub arrest
item.description: The MTV personality has tweeted out pictures of her bruised arms in support of her police brutality claims, even though the officers who restrained her were actually private security guards, not cops.

item.title: Homeless man Michael Migani arrested for giving 'wet willy' to 4-year-old boy
item.description: Michael Migani, 34, was arrested by Shelton, Connecticut police on Wednesday after allegedly giving a 4-year-old boy he didn't know a 'wet willy.'

item.title: Android fingerprint warning as hackers say data can be stolen and used for fraud
item.description: Hackers are set to demonstrate four different attacks at a Las Vegas conference showing how the data could be stolen and used for fraud.

item.title: Eric Warfel kept his dead baby daughter's decomposed body for month in crib
item.description: An Ohio grand jury on Tuesday chose to indict Eric Warfel, 34, on felony charges of abusing a corpse and tampering with evidence for keeping the corpse of his 21-month-old daughter Ember.

item.title: Breakups hurt women more in the short term but men NEVER recover
item.description: Women reported higher levels of both physical and emotional pain. However, researchers said that, over time, they came put stronger - while men simply moved on and never fully recover.
item.media:description:
Couple arguing over bills.
Image by Artiga Photo/Corbis

item.title: Photographer David de Rueda captures images of abandoned Cold War era buildings
item.description: The forgotten relics of Europe's Soviet past have been captured - some for the first time - by urban exploration photographer David de Rueda, who visited nine countries in six weeks.

item.title: British millionaire and his Brazilian model wife sue luxury Miami hotel for £570,000 after thieves stole £51,000 in watches from room with a faulty door
item.description: Millionaire British investor Oliver Ripley (right) and his supermodel wife Jeisa Chiminazzo (left) have sued a luxury hotel in Miami after thieves broke into their room and stole their £51,000 watches

item.title: Jeb Bush turns on Donald Trump in outburst to Republican donor
item.description: 'Seriously, what’s this guy’s problem?' Bush reportedly said.

item.title: Yoseop Choi accused of beating his baby boy to death
item.description: A 5-month-old baby boy who was allegedly beaten by his New Jersey father died in the hospital on Thursday. Yoseop Choi, 38, has been charged with murder for his son's death.
item.media:description: A 5-month-old baby boy who New Jersey prosecutors say was beaten by his father has died after more than a week in the hospital. Bergen County Prosecutor John Molinelli says the baby died Thursday at Bellevue Hospital in New York. Molinelli says charges against the baby's father, 38-year-old Yoseop Choi, will be upgraded to homicide. The Fort Lee man was being held on $750,000 bail and charged with aggravated assault and child endangerment. A message left with Choi's attorney wasn't immediately returned.

item.title: Susan Sarandon calls for Oklahoma death row inmate Richard Glossip to be spared
item.description: Richard Glossip, from Oklahoma, is due to die by lethal injection next month but has always maintained his innocence. Actress Susan Sarandon said his case showed everything wrong with death penalty.

item.title: Optical illusions video reveals how easy it is to fool our brains
item.description: The video, created by Inside Science TV, takes a look at a number of famous illusions, including the Hermann Grid, the Mach Bands illusion and the rotating snakes.

item.title: Nana Betty, 89, serves as a bridesmaid for her granddaughter Christine Quinn
item.description: Christine Quinn, from Plymouth, Pennsylvania, said she asked Betty Govern, or Nana Betty for short, to stand beside her at her May 2 nuptials simply because she is one of her best friends.

item.title: Bigamist and 'first' wife charged for deaths of his 2nd wife, children and mother-in-law
item.description: Bigamist Christopher Matthew Henderson, 40, (pictured right) and wife Rhonda Carlson, 42, of Alabama, have been charged Thursday in the deaths of four people including his 'second' wife.

item.title: Hangover make up trend in Japan sees women with red puffy eyes and greasy hair
item.description: There is nothing worse than feeling hungover, but LOOKING hungover is the latest beauty trend sweeping Japan. Women apply blush under the eye and create wet-look hair to achieve the look.

item.title: Most embarrassing #fieldworkfail mistakes revealed on Twitter
item.description: From inadvertently eating cheetah faeces to accidentally exchanging saliva with dead animals, the hundreds of tweets show research can be full of amusing blunders.

item.title: Two disabled girls wheelchair dance to Silento's hip hop hit Whip/Nae Nae
item.description: Mayli and Brooklyn learned the dance at their Ayita Wheelchair Dance class in Fort Worth, Texas, which is run by Mayli's mom. The moves are adapted to work around - and work with - their wheelchairs.

item.title: Texas husband surprises his wife Nia Rader by revealing that she's pregnant
item.description: Sam Rader, 29 found out that his wife Nia, 26, was pregnant before she did because the mother-of-two doesn't flush in the middle of the night. So the Texas native broke the news to her on camera.

item.title: Spice Girls 'to reunite for huge world tour WITHOUT Victoria Beckham'
item.description: The girl group released their debut single in 1996 and will celebrate two decades in the spotlight by hitting the road together next year - however, Victoria has decided to sit the trek out.

item.title: Northern California Coast Guard crew makes $181M drug bust
item.description: The Coast Guard seized 12,000 pounds of cocaine from the vessel in the Eastern Pacific - 200 miles south of Mexico - but a further 4,000 pounds sank with the boat as it was towed to shore.

item.title: Forget the naughty step, reasoning is the best way to tackle tantrums
item.description: Scientists at the National University in the US studied how 102 parents dealt with their children when they were naughty and found the naughty step was one of the least effective approaches.

item.title: Father's tattoo tribute to daughter who has two hearing implants goes viral
item.description: Alistair Campbell, from New Zealand, got the inking done as his daughter Charlotte was due to have her second cochlear implant fitted because she has almost total hearing loss.
item.media:description:
Father gets cochlear implant tattoo to match his daughter So Alistair Campbell shaved all his hair off and had his own implant tattooed onto his bald head to show six-year-old Charlotte how much he loved her. And Charlotte LOVED the gesture. She giggled, touched it and said it was ?cool? when her father had the artwork etched on over the weekend. Mr Campbell also posted a picture to Facebook where it has been shared dozens of times.
Read more: http://metro.co.uk/2015/08/06/amazing-father-gets-cochlear-implant-tattoo-for-his-six-year-old-daughter-5329901/#ixzz3i2TEMtLk Read more: http://metro.co.uk/2015/08/06/amazing-father-gets-cochlear-implant-tattoo-for-his-six-year-old-daughter-5329901/#ixzz3i2TAcOMS

item.title: Woman with IBS goes from a size ten to a size zero to a size six
item.description: Jenna Birch, 23, from Ann Arbor, Michigan, was a size ten until the age of 21. The writer shrunk to a size zero (left) after suffering from irritable bowel syndrome. She is now a healthy size six (right).

item.title: 10th person dies in New York Legionnaires' disease outbreak
item.description: New York City officials say 10 people have died in the outbreak of Legionnaires' Disease centered in the South Bronx, and a total of 100 cases have been diagnosed.

item.title: Family barred from entering pizza restaurant with disabled son
item.description: Matt Brown, 30, said he tried to take son Colton, who has to be strapped to a medical stroller because of a debilitating spinal condition, into Nicola Pizza in Delaware, but was refused entry.

item.title: Shaina Foster jailed for tying 'sugar-daddy', 85, to a coffee table and stealing credit cards
item.description: Shaina Foster, 18, went on a date with retired lawyer Paul Aronson in New York in October 2014 after the pair met online, then constrained him and robbed him at his Manhattan townhouse

item.title: Bill Clinton denies encouraging Donald Trump to run against wife Hillary
item.description: Trump initiated the calls, not former president Clinton, whose wife Hillary is now seeking the White House, it indicated. Clinton did call him back eventually, but they didn't discuss the 2016 race.

item.title: Willis-Knighton hospital medics surprise cancer patient, 12, with 'The Whip' flashmob
item.description: Sophia Petikas had just completed a course of radiotherapy at the Willis-Knighton Cancer Center in Louisiana when staff spontaneously broke into dance.

item.title: 65 bills become law in Maine after governor Paul LePage missed veto deadline
item.description: The Maine Supreme Judicial Court sided with legislative leadership in their dispute with Gov Paul LePage, saying that lawmakers' adjournment in June didn't prevent him from vetoing the bills.
item.media:description: Republican gubernatorial candidate Paul LePage pauses during a news conference where he outlined his job-creation plan, in Augusta, Maine, on Monday, Sept. 13, 2010. LePage deflected questions about taxes paid on a Florida home. He replied testily that questions about tax exemptions claimed by his wife already have been answered. The Kennebec Journal reported last week that Ann LePage claimed permanent residency in both states and could be fined in Florida. LePage's campaign described it as a "paperwork error." (AP Photo/Pat Wellenbach)

item.title: Teacher Emily Zarnoch, 23, killed by 'drunk' hit-and-run driver in Maine
item.description: Emily Zarnoch, 23, of Massachusetts, was walking hand-in-hand with her boyfriend Tuesday in York, Maine, after a night out when an SUV struck her, throwing her body 60 feet in the air.
item.media:description:
Quincy Teacher, 23, Killed By Alleged Drunk Driver In Maine Hit-And-Run
YORK, MAINE (CBS) ? A 23-year-old Quincy woman was killed early Tuesday morning when she was struck by an allegedly drunk driver while walking along a street in Maine, police say. York police said they were called just after midnight to Ridge Road, where a vehicle hit the woman walking with her boyfriend in the shoulder area of the street before fleeing the scene. Quincy native Emily Zarnoch. (Family Photo) Quincy native Emily Zarnoch. (Family Photo) Emily Zarnoch, of Quincy, died at a local hospital from her injuries. Zarnoch was set to start teaching this fall at Central Middle School In Quincy where she had been substitute teaching. ?No matter who you speak to, this girl is a special kid,? Quincy Mayor Tom Koch said. A short time after the crash, officers spotted a vehicle with front-end damage that matched a description from the scene and arrested the driver. Carolyn Lee (Photo credit York police) Carolyn Lee

item.title: Stolen Ames Stradivarius violin is recovered after 35 years
item.description: A Stradivarius violin which disappeared 35 years ago has been found after it was handed in by the ex-wife of a man suspected of stealing it. In 1980, the instrument was taken from Roman Totenberg.

item.title: The injection that can instantly cure drug addicts
item.description: Scripps researchers found a single injection of early drug candidate called blebbistatin cured animals. Researchers hope to first use the drug to treat meth addicts.
item.media:description: Crystal meth cocaine methamphetamine. Image shot 2002. Exact date unknown.

item.title: Infertile cancer survivor Mimi Lee battling to save frozen embryos speaks out
item.description: Mimi Lee, 46, says the five embryos she froze with her husband, Stephen Findlay, in 2010 are her last chance at having children, but he is fighting to have them discarded following an acrimonious divorce.

item.title: Death of Alexander Perepilichnyy 'linked to death of Alexander Litvinenko'
item.description: Alexander Perepilichnyy, pictured, a key witness in a £140million tax fraud investigation, collapsed while jogging outside his £3million mansion in Weybridge, Surrey, in November 2012.

item.title: Russia hacked Pentagon's Joint Chiefs of Staff and shut down its email system
item.description: The 'sophisticated cyber intrusion' occurred sometime around July 25 and impacted military and civilian personnel working inside the Pentagon, reports suggest.

item.title: Alabama teacher Joe Petrey arrested as photos of 'sex romp with student' emerged
item.description: An Alabama high school teacher has been charged with sexual contact with a student after photos surfaced online of him and a recently-graduated student in an inappropriate relationship.

item.title: Juan Jimenez-Olivera pleads guilty to murdering his pizza parlor co-worker
item.description: Juan Jimenez-Olivera, 30, of New Jersey, has pleaded guilty to murder, aggravated arson, theft and desecrating human remains in the April 2014 slaying of Sviatlana Dranko.

item.title: Real life Popeye Jeff Dabe has 49cm forearms aims for Armwrestling championship
item.description: Jeff Dabe, pictured, from Minnesota, has earned himself the nickname Popeye because of his huge forearms in the World Armwrestling League where he can use his natural advantage.

item.title: Police arrest serial rapist for murder of Mexican journalist Ruben Espinosa
item.description: A man has been arrested in connection with the brutal killing of photojournalist Ruben Espinosa in Mexico City. Four women, including social activist Nadia Vera pictured, were killed.

item.title: Cara Delevingne auctions Tag Heuer watch to raise money for Cecil the lion
item.description: Cara Delevingne is auctioning her Tag Heuer watch on Ebay to raise money for conservation project WildCru, which was studying Cecil the lion when he was shot in Zimbabwe.

item.title: How a reliance on protein powder is as dangerous as anorexia
item.description: Scientists in California found more than 40 per cent of men surveyed increased their use of whey protein, creatine and other supplements over time, with eight per cent being warned to cut back by their doctor.

item.title: Osama bin Laden's family killed in jet crash after pilot had to overtake microlight
item.description: The £7million private jet carrying Bin Laden's stepmother and half-sister also issued six warning alerts before it plunged into a car auction site in Hampshire on Friday, an initial report found.

item.title: Zachary Hammond shot dead by police 'murdered from behind'
item.description: Zachary Hammond, 19, was gunned down on July 26 in the parking lot of a fast food restaurant in Seneca, South Carolina, while his date Tori Morton, 23, ate ice cream alongside him.

item.title: Ohio teen whose boyfriend was about to propose is electrocuted and killed
item.description: Stephanie Bush, 18, from Roseville, Ohio, was electrocuted and passed away from her injuries July 28, just as her live-in boyfriend was getting ready to ask her father's blessing to marry her.
item.media:description:
Stephanie Bush's friends and family gathered inside the local American Legion, all them wearing yellow.
Loved ones slowly trickled into the Main Street building in Roseville after Bush's funeral service in White Cottage. And almost all wore her favorite color to remember Bush, who died July 28 after she was electrocuted while jumping her vehicle.
Yellow was always her favorite color, although no one is quite sure the reason, said Nancy Bush, Stephanie's mother.

item.title: Estranged Texas couple's two sons, 11 and 14, watched as father shot dead mother
item.description: The suspected murder-suicide took place at a Timewise Exxon gas station in The Woodlands, where the recently separated couple arrived to exchange temporary custody of their children.
item.media:description: A man shot dead his ex-wife before turning the gun on himself at a Texas gas station Wednesday as the couple's two teenage sons looked on. The suspected murder-suicide took place at a Timewise Exxon gas station in The Woodlands, where the recently separated couple arrived to exchange temporary custody of their children. Montgomery County Sheriff's deputies were called to the scene in the 6500 block of College Park Drive at around 7.30pm in response to reports of a shooting. Responding officers discovered a man and a woman lying on the ground with gunshot wounds. The husband was pronounced dead at the scene, while his wife was taken to a hospital where she later succumbed to her injuries. Witnesses said the parents were having a conversation about their children?s custody at the gas station when the man got angry, pulled a gun and shot his spouse in the head before killing himself. The couple's two sons witnessed the murder-suicide of their parents but were not physically harmed. The

item.title: New deep-sea anglerfish discovered in the Gulf of Mexico
item.description: The new fish was discovered by a researcher at the Nova Southeastern University's (NSU) Halmos College of Natural Sciences and Oceanography in the gulf of Mexico.

item.title: RollJam $30 'universal car remote' that could give hackers access
item.description: The hacker behind the project says it will open cars from Chrysler, Daewoo, Fiat, GM, Honda, Toyota, Volvo, Volkswagen Group, Clifford, Shurlok, and Jaguar.

item.title: World War II veteran Eligio Ramos has wallet returned from Austria after 70 years
item.description: Eligio Ramos, 91, of Fresno, California recently received the wallet he lost 70 years ago in the mail, after a doctor in Austria found it in a farmhouse where Ramos once spent the night during WWII.

item.title: Ferguson police officers speak out for first time year since Michael Brown
item.description: Serving Ferguson officers have spoken for the first time, days before the anniversary of the death of Michael Brown, to tell Daily Mail 'Online of their ordeal working in the aftermath of controversial shooting.

item.title: The Lion King animator honors Cecil with illustration inspired by Disney classic
item.description: Aaron Blaise is a Disney animator who worked on the 1994 hit film. fter being 'extremely moved' by the slaughter of Cecil the Lion, he honored the late animal with a Lion King-inspired picture.

item.title: Democratic Party unveils schedule for six presidential debates - with first one set for October (but not all candidates are happy)
item.description: As Republicans prepare for the first debate of the 2016 presidential campaign, the Democratic National Committee has unveiled plans to hold six debates, with the first starting this fall in Nevada.

item.title: From skirts to Speedos, how men's swimsuit styles have evolved over 100 years
item.description: The new clip, which was created by Mode, charts the evolution of the swimsuit over the past 100 years, beginning in 1915 when swimming dresses were the swimsuit of choice, to present day.

item.title: Michigan judge reconsiders case of man, 19, whose date lied about her age
item.description: Zach Anderson was sentenced to 90 days in prison by Judge Dennis Wiley earlier this year after driving 20 miles from his parents' Indiana home to Niles, Michigan, and having sex with the girl.

item.title: Maryland man discovers he is heir to the throne of the Isle of Man
item.description: In the new TLC reality series Suddenly Royal, David Drew Howe, 45, an auto-repair specialist from Maryland, takes his wife Pam and their daughter Grace to the UK to learn how to act like royalty.

item.title: Real Housewife Lisa Hochstein sued by interior designer of Miami mansion
item.description: Reality star Lisa, 33, and her plastic surgeon husband Lenny, 47, were being sued by their interior designer who claimed they lied about having a $5 million budget for work on their Miami mansion.

item.title: Jury finds Seth Culver who shot MacKeon Schulte to be justified in killing
item.description: A jury convened for an inquest into the shooting death of a Montana teenager determined the shooter, a friend of the victim, committed justifiable homicide and was not criminal.

item.title: Mad Max theater gunman's mother reported him missing 2 days before he attacked
item.description: Denise Pruett, the mother of Vincente David Montano, 29, contacted police in Murfreesboro, Tennessee, and revealed her son was diagnosed with paranoid schizophrenia in 2006.

item.title: Nasa say El Nino may bring relief to California, but it could cause 'mayhem' elsewhere
item.description: Nasa scientists claim conditions in the Pacific Ocean are now stronger than they were in the summer of 1997, when a massive El Niño was brewing.

item.title: Why it IS easier to work out to music - it dulls the pain
item.description: Listening to our favourite music makes the brain release natural painkilling chemicals called opioids – the same family of drugs as heroin and morphine, found research from McGill University.

item.title: Deadly frogs use their heads as SPEARS to deliver toxin that can kill 80 people
item.description: Biologists only realised the two species of frog, which live in the Brazilian rainforest, were venomous after getting on the wrong end of their spines while collecting the amphibians.

item.title: Tennessee school psychologist Richard Pitcock charged with child porn possession
item.description: Richard Pitcock, 51, from Ashland City, Tennessee, is a licensed psychologist who works with special-needs kids in grades K-12. He was arrested Tuesday night at a hotel in Hollywood, South Florida.

item.title: Married family doctor Binh Chung 'drugged and raped a mother and teen daughter'
item.description: Binh 'Ben' Chung, 41, a married father with two young daughters, has been accused of attacking 11 of his patients in his Las Vegas practice, including a mom and her daughter.
item.media:description: This undated photo provided by the Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department shows Binh "Ben" Chung. Chung, a Las Vegas doctor, has been arrested on child pornography charges. Authorities say the 41-year-old was taken into custody Sunday, June 21, 2015, and is facing charges of using a minor over age 14 to produce child porn and 10 counts of possession of child porn. (Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department via AP)

item.title: Arkansas dentist makes witty sign distancing himself from Cecil the lion killer
item.description: Hagerty Family Dental surgery put the tongue-in-cheek sign outside its practice in Arkansas to assure people that not all dentists are like despised Cecil-killer Walter Palmer.

item.title: Cecil the lion’s cubs have been adopted by their uncle Jericho
item.description: The infant lions have been adopted by their new pride leader, under the watchful eye of their uncle Jericho, in Hwange National Park, Zimbabwe.

item.title: Heroin addict, 23, dies of an overdose 'after giving birth to stillborn baby'
item.description: Kimberly Ann Karosy, 23, died on Saturday at her home in North Royalton, Ohio in an apparent heroin overdose just hours after giving birth.

item.title: Rick Santorum's son Richard John charged with DWI after police stop him driv
item.description: Richard John Santorum, Jr, 22, known as John, was stopped at a DUI checkpoint in suburban Virginia at around midnight on July 11 with 'glassy eyes' and 'slurred speech'.

item.title: Dancer Daysha Phillips dies from illegal butt injection by women on police bail
item.description: Daysha Phillips, 22, is said to have got the illicit lift with three other women inside a room at a Drury Inn in St Louis, Missouri, on July 26. Two days later she was rushed to hospital with breathing problems.

item.title: Queen Letizia sparks fears over health after revealing frighteningly skinny arms in Palma
item.description: The Spanish royal, 42, showed off a pair of extremely slender arms as she welcomed guests to the La Almudaina Palace in Palma last night. Letizia is currently holidaying in Mallorca with her family.

item.title: Twin saved in China's first operation to divide conjoined babies thanks doctor
item.description: Doctors worked over 10 hours to separate the twins in successful surgery. Operation was the first successful separation of conjoined twins in China. Gu Qiao is now 19 and will go to university soon.

item.title: Robots deployed to cater to hotel guests' needs and navigate the lift
item.description: The Crowne Plaza San Jose-Silicon Valley hotel in the U.S. and the Aloft Hotels brand of Starwood Hotels are both utilising androids in the hospitality sector, both created by Savioke.

item.title: Shocking moment a bull is ‘illegally’ executed with shotgun on Spanish street
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: The bull, called Guapetón, was shot dead in Coria, south-west Spain, after he attacked a man during the town's annual bull running festival - sparking outrage from animal rights groups.

item.title: Groom brought a room to tears by dropping to his knees to dance with his mother
item.description: In 2008, Luke Rheault, 33, from Fitchburg, Massachusetts, danced with his ALS-stricken mother Rebekah at his wedding, less than a year before she died, and didn't watch the video until now.

item.title: Tinder-inspired app CrewMe connects pilots and cabin crew looking for romance
item.description: Inspired by the likes of Tinder, Hinge and OKCupid, CrewMe is a brand new dating app, developed by a pilot - catering to flight crew on layover in foreign locales.

item.title: FBI 'running criminal probe into Hillary Clinton's secret email server
item.description: Former CIA director Gen. David Petraeus and former Bill Clinton-era national security adviser Sandy Berger have both been prosecuted under the same law Hillary is thought to have broken.
item.media:description: Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton laughs with supporters as she arrives for a campaign kickoff event in Denver, Colorado August 4, 2015. REUTERS/Rick Wilking

item.title: Female software engineer Isis Wenger slammed for being 'too pretty' fights back
item.description: Software engineer, Isis Anchalee Wenger, 22, appeared in an ad for her San-Francisco based company, OneLogin, there was just one problem. People didn't believe she was 'real.'

item.title: San Francisco light pole corroded by URINE topples onto car
item.description: Shocked witnesses said the driver would almost certainly have died had he been pulled up slightly closer to a stop light Monday evening.

item.title: Photographer Lilana Taboas Cruz celebrates mothers' postpartum bodies
item.description: Puerto Rican American photographer Liliana Taboas Cruz, 27, started her project, Divine Mothering after suffering a miscarriage. The mother-of-two now photographs mothers of all ages.

item.title: How parents whose sons, two and five, are BOTH dying from rare and incurable brain disease are making the most of their final years as a family while raising awareness
item.description: Bekah and Danny Bowman, from Orange County, California, were told this spring that their sons Titus, five, and Ely, two, are suffering from late infantile-NCL, an incurable form of Batten disease.

item.title: Failing New York Liberty high school gives 11th graders The Three Little Pigs to read
item.description: The finding came after a two-day review of Landmark High School in Manhattan, which showed many of the children didn't have enough access to age-appropriate books in class.

item.title: Four members of a Palestinian family are killed when an Israeli shell from the last year's war explodes, destroying their home
item.description: Four Palestinians were killed and another 40 injured today when an unexploded Israeli missile detonated while workers clearing rubble from last summer's 50-day war.

item.title: Tornado captured on film by shepherd show creating a column of sand
item.description: Shepherd was taking his sheep out to fodder when he spotted the tornado. He captured footage of the incident in Guinan, central China, on August 2. Tornado rose to several thousand feet in the air.

item.title: Chinese sex education teaches pupils about condoms and masturbation with parents
item.description: A special summer camp was held last week in Chongqing, southwest China. Pupil aged 11 to 18 attended the three-day event with their parents to learn more about their bodies.

item.title: 50 Cent puts his Connecticut estate up for lease after filing for bankruptcy
item.description: Rapper 50 Cent, who filed for personal bankruptcy last month, is trying to lease his Connecticut home valued at nearly $8.3 million.

item.title: More than 3,500 people detained in secretive Chicago police warehouse
item.description: New documents reveal that thousands of people have been held at the secretive Homan Square facility in west Chicago. People were detained for a range of offences - 82 percent of those held were black.

item.title: Tami Dee Bachart who sent a LOADED gun in the mail avoids prison
item.description: An Idaho woman who mailed a loaded gun to Connecticut was sentenced to one year of probation and ordered to pay about $4,300 in restitution and fines.

item.title: Retired pFlorida olice officer shoots 16-year-old burglar he caught stealing neighbor's TV
item.description: The ex-cop was walking through his neighborhood in Grand Island Ridge, Florida, Tuesday with his wife, who is also a retired officer, when they saw a suspicious teen leaving their neighbor's house.

item.title: GoFish 'GoPro for fishing' camera attaches to a line to film underwater
item.description: Houston-based brothers Ryan and Brandon Austin have developed the GoFish Cam that attaches to a line and can work at depths of 150 metres to reveal the moment a fish takes a bait.

item.title: Ex-Ohio police chief Clark Gast charged with beating wife her suicide
item.description: Ex-Ohio police chief Clark Gast has been charged with assaulting wife Laura the day before she died in an apparent suicide. Her family, backed by Brown County's prosecutor, claim she was murdered.

item.title: Could YOU pass a sex test for teens? Try the exam devised by sexologist Goedele Liekens
item.description: The questions form part of an exam devised by former Miss Belgium Goedele Liekens, which she has recommended be incorporated into a GCSE on sex in a C4 documentary tonight.

item.title: Camera fitted to hammerhead shark shows how it stalks its prey
item.description: The GoPro camera stayed on the shark's fin for almost three hours and took in a tour of the sea bed to give photographer Mr Casagrande a unique viewpoint of the creature's adventures.

item.title: Human brain auto-tunes colours as they become more abundant through the seasons
item.description: Scientists at the University of York’s Department of Psychology set out to explore why 'unique' yellow is so stable and the factors that make it change.

item.title: Are you an eager beaver, a chancer or a drama queen? Quiz reveals what your co-workers REALLY think of you
item.description: While we're all guilty of moaning about a lazy colleague or a gossipy work friend, have you ever stopped to think what your co-workers may think about you?

item.title: Florida woman battered her girlfriend because she refused to give her a kiss
item.description: The couple argued once over the refusal of a kiss at a friend's house, then later that night, the went back to their home in Florida and Shantrell Owens struck her partner after yet another refusal.

item.title: Beauty hacks to shave minutes off your morning regime
item.description: Whether it's choosing double-duty products or getting organised with your cosmetics, it all plays a hand in keeping morning routines fuss and stress-free. FEMAIL rounds up the top tricks.

item.title: Relatives of MH370 victims refuse to believe wing fragment came from plane
item.description: Aircraft seats and windows have now washed up ashore on Reunion Island - the same location a piece of plane wing from missing passenger jet MH370 was discovered one week ago.

item.title: Women with breast implants are THREE times more likely to commit suicide
item.description: Women who get breast implants may already have psychiatric problems to do with lower self-esteem or body image disorders, according to researchers from the Vanderbilt University Medical Center.

item.title: Gabrielle Markel tried to use pepper spray as she was mauled by grizzly bear in Alaska
item.description: Gabrielle Markel, 20, pictured, was pinned down by the adult brown bear which had stepped out of thick brush along a trail near Skilak Lake on Alaska's Kenai Peninsula.

item.title: Hitman sent to kill his Russian girlfriend's office rival
item.description: The 25-year-old woman was no more than bruised from the bullet and started screaming for help in a block of flats in Krasnodar, southern Russia. The man was arrested when police prized open the lift door.

item.title: Miss Bumbum model Andressa Urach reveals her sordid life as a 'luxury hooker'
item.description: Brazilian Andressa Urach, 28, is writing tell-all book about how she fell into a squalid life as a hooker, bedding millionaire businessmen and married football stars around the world.

item.title: Can a cosmetic treatment make you 'scientifically beautiful'?
item.description: Emily Adair, 30, underwent the procedure earlier this year, and paid £999 for dermal fillers injections in her nose and chin. She said she cried with joy after seeing the results.

item.title: Algerian man sues wife one day after wedding after seeing her without make-up
item.description: The husband told an Algerian court that he was so shocked after seeing his bride's face the day after their wedding that he failed to even recognise her - accusing her of being a thief that had broken in.

item.title: Rare photographs show the aftermath of Hiroshima after the atomic bomb
item.description: Horrifically injured locals are pictured wandering along flattened streets strewn with corpses in the western Japanese city only hours after the nuclear bomb, nicknamed 'Little Boy', was dropped.

item.title: Crow can't stop looking at its reflection in Tokyo shop window
item.description: The self-obsessed bird was oblivious to the amused reactions of passers-by as it ensured there wasn't a feather out of place by grooming itself roadside in Shinjuku, Tokyo.

item.title: Southwest Airlines pilot plays Top Gun song on take-off
item.description: Footage captured by a passenger reveals the moment a flight attendant recreated a scene from the Tom Cruise film as the plane barrelled down the runway.

item.title: CydeKick Pro transforms your bicycle into a mains-free phone charger
item.description: The Cydekick Pro generates, stores and delivers power to your phone, and its makers say it does this without any extra mechanical friction so you won't notice it as you pedal.

item.title: Mood glasses designed by Bence Agoston simulate psychedelic hallucinations of LSD
item.description: An artist from Bucharest, Hungary, created ‘Mood’ spectacles that simulate hallucinations using patterned lenses, which can be rotated to create optical illusions.

item.title: Mako shark jumps 12 feet into the air alongside boat and terrifies the fisherman on board in incredible footage
item.description: This is the incredible moment a Mako shark propelled itself from the water alongside a fishing boat and reached heights of up to 12 feet – terrifying the fisherman on board in California.

item.title: These are the world's most haunted hotels
item.description: For adventurous travellers looking for a night to remember, consider checking into these spooky spots, including a converted prison and a luxurious Italian residence haunted by Mussolini.
